module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange

-- | A range of dates and times that is used by the <a>EventFilter</a> and
--   <a>EntityFilter</a> objects. If <tt>from</tt> is set and <tt>to</tt>
--   is set: match items where the timestamp (<tt>startTime</tt>,
--   <tt>endTime</tt>, or <tt>lastUpdatedTime</tt>) is between
--   <tt>from</tt> and <tt>to</tt> inclusive. If <tt>from</tt> is set and
--   <tt>to</tt> is not set: match items where the timestamp value is equal
--   to or after <tt>from</tt>. If <tt>from</tt> is not set and <tt>to</tt>
--   is set: match items where the timestamp value is equal to or before
--   <tt>to</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDateTimeRange</a> smart constructor.
data DateTimeRange
DateTimeRange' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> DateTimeRange

-- | The ending date and time of a time range.
[$sel:to:DateTimeRange'] :: DateTimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The starting date and time of a time range.
[$sel:from:DateTimeRange'] :: DateTimeRange -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DateTimeRange</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:to:DateTimeRange'</a>, <a>dateTimeRange_to</a> - The ending
--   date and time of a time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:from:DateTimeRange'</a>, <a>dateTimeRange_from</a> - The
--   starting date and time of a time range.
newDateTimeRange :: DateTimeRange

-- | The ending date and time of a time range.
dateTimeRange_to :: Lens' DateTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The starting date and time of a time range.
dateTimeRange_from :: Lens' DateTimeRange (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.DateTimeRange.DateTimeRange

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EntityFilter

data EntityFilter

-- | A list of entity status codes (<tt>IMPAIRED</tt>, <tt>UNIMPAIRED</tt>,

--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
[$sel:tags:EntityFilter'] :: EntityFilter -> Maybe [HashMap Text Text]

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.AffectedEntity

-- | Information about an entity that is affected by a Health event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAffectedEntity</a> smart constructor.
data AffectedEntity
AffectedEntity' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe EntityStatusCode -> AffectedEntity

-- | The most recent time that the entity was updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTime:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The ID of the affected entity.
[$sel:entityValue:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the affected entity.
[$sel:entityUrl:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe Text

-- | The 12-digit AWS account number that contains the affected entity.
[$sel:awsAccountId:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
[$sel:eventArn:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the entity. Format:
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:entity-region:aws-account:entity/entity-id </tt>.
--   Example:
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:us-east-1:111222333444:entity/AVh5GGT7ul1arKr1sE1K</tt>
[$sel:entityArn:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe Text

-- | A map of entity tags attached to the affected entity.
--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
[$sel:tags:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The most recent status of the entity affected by the event. The
--   possible values are <tt>IMPAIRED</tt>, <tt>UNIMPAIRED</tt>, and
--   <tt>UNKNOWN</tt>.
[$sel:statusCode:AffectedEntity'] :: AffectedEntity -> Maybe EntityStatusCode

-- | Create a value of <a>AffectedEntity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:AffectedEntity'</a>,
--   <a>affectedEntity_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The most recent time that the
--   entity was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityValue:AffectedEntity'</a>,
--   <a>affectedEntity_entityValue</a> - The ID of the affected entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityUrl:AffectedEntity'</a>, <a>affectedEntity_entityUrl</a>
--   - The URL of the affected entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsAccountId:AffectedEntity'</a>,
--   <a>affectedEntity_awsAccountId</a> - The 12-digit AWS account number
--   that contains the affected entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventArn:AffectedEntity'</a>, <a>affectedEntity_eventArn</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityArn:AffectedEntity'</a>, <a>affectedEntity_entityArn</a>
--   - The unique identifier for the entity. Format:
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:entity-region:aws-account:entity/entity-id </tt>.
--   Example:
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:us-east-1:111222333444:entity/AVh5GGT7ul1arKr1sE1K</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AffectedEntity'</a>, <a>affectedEntity_tags</a> - A map
--   of entity tags attached to the affected entity.
--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:AffectedEntity'</a>,
--   <a>affectedEntity_statusCode</a> - The most recent status of the
--   entity affected by the event. The possible values are
--   <tt>IMPAIRED</tt>, <tt>UNIMPAIRED</tt>, and <tt>UNKNOWN</tt>.
newAffectedEntity :: AffectedEntity

-- | The most recent time that the entity was updated.
affectedEntity_lastUpdatedTime :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ID of the affected entity.
affectedEntity_entityValue :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the affected entity.
affectedEntity_entityUrl :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe Text)

-- | The 12-digit AWS account number that contains the affected entity.
affectedEntity_awsAccountId :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
affectedEntity_eventArn :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the entity. Format:
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:entity-region:aws-account:entity/entity-id </tt>.
--   Example:
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:us-east-1:111222333444:entity/AVh5GGT7ul1arKr1sE1K</tt>
affectedEntity_entityArn :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe Text)

-- | A map of entity tags attached to the affected entity.
--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
affectedEntity_tags :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The most recent status of the entity affected by the event. The
--   possible values are <tt>IMPAIRED</tt>, <tt>UNIMPAIRED</tt>, and
--   <tt>UNKNOWN</tt>.
affectedEntity_statusCode :: Lens' AffectedEntity (Maybe EntityStatusCode)

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.AffectedEntity.AffectedEntity

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventAccountFilter

-- | The values used to filter results from the
--   <a>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</a> and
--   <a>DescribeAffectedEntitiesForOrganization</a> operations.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventAccountFilter</a> smart constructor.

-- | The 12-digit AWS account numbers that contains the affected entities.
[$sel:awsAccountId:EventAccountFilter'] :: EventAccountFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456

--   numbers that contains the affected entities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventArn:EventAccountFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventAccountFilter_eventArn</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>

-- | The 12-digit AWS account numbers that contains the affected entities.
eventAccountFilter_awsAccountId :: Lens' EventAccountFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventAggregate

-- | The number of events of each issue type. Returned by the
--   <a>DescribeEventAggregates</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventAggregate</a> smart constructor.
data EventAggregate

-- | The number of events of the associated issue type.
[$sel:count:EventAggregate'] :: EventAggregate -> Maybe Int

-- | The issue type for the associated count.
[$sel:aggregateValue:EventAggregate'] :: EventAggregate -> Maybe Text

--   <a>eventAggregate_aggregateValue</a> - The issue type for the
--   associated count.

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventAggregate.EventAggregate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventAggregate.EventAggregate

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription

-- | The detailed description of the event. Included in the information
--   returned by the <a>DescribeEventDetails</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDescription</a> smart constructor.
data EventDescription
EventDescription' :: Maybe Text -> EventDescription

-- | The most recent description of the event.
[$sel:latestDescription:EventDescription'] :: EventDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestDescription:EventDescription'</a>,
--   <a>eventDescription_latestDescription</a> - The most recent
--   description of the event.
newEventDescription :: EventDescription

-- | The most recent description of the event.
eventDescription_latestDescription :: Lens' EventDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDescription.EventDescription


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem

-- | Error information returned when a <a>DescribeEventDetails</a>
--   operation can't find a specified event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDetailsErrorItem</a> smart constructor.
data EventDetailsErrorItem
EventDetailsErrorItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EventDetailsErrorItem

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
[$sel:eventArn:EventDetailsErrorItem'] :: EventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the error.
[$sel:errorName:EventDetailsErrorItem'] :: EventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | A message that describes the error.
[$sel:errorMessage:EventDetailsErrorItem'] :: EventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDetailsErrorItem</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventArn:EventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>eventDetailsErrorItem_eventArn</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorName:EventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>eventDetailsErrorItem_errorName</a> - The name of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:EventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>eventDetailsErrorItem_errorMessage</a> - A message that describes
--   the error.
newEventDetailsErrorItem :: EventDetailsErrorItem

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
eventDetailsErrorItem_eventArn :: Lens' EventDetailsErrorItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the error.
eventDetailsErrorItem_errorName :: Lens' EventDetailsErrorItem (Maybe Text)

-- | A message that describes the error.
eventDetailsErrorItem_errorMessage :: Lens' EventDetailsErrorItem (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetailsErrorItem.EventDetailsErrorItem

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType

-- | Contains the metadata about a type of event that is reported by AWS
--   Health. The <tt>EventType</tt> shows the category, service, and the
--   event type code of the event. For example, an <tt>issue</tt> might be
--   the category, <tt>EC2</tt> the service, and
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt> the event type code.
--   
--   You can use the <a>DescribeEventTypes</a> API operation to return this
--   information about an event.
--   
--   You can also use the Amazon CloudWatch Events console to create a rule
--   so that you can get notified or take action when AWS Health delivers a
--   specific event to your AWS account. For more information, see
--   <a>Monitor for AWS Health events with Amazon CloudWatch Events</a> in
--   the <i>AWS Health User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventType</a> smart constructor.
data EventType
EventType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EventTypeCategory -> Maybe Text -> EventType

-- | The AWS service that is affected by the event. For example,
--   <tt>EC2</tt>, <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:service:EventType'] :: EventType -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
[$sel:category:EventType'] :: EventType -> Maybe EventTypeCategory

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION </tt>; for example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
[$sel:code:EventType'] :: EventType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EventType</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:EventType'</a>, <a>eventType_service</a> - The AWS
--   service that is affected by the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:category:EventType'</a>, <a>eventType_category</a> - A list of
--   event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>, <tt>scheduledChange</tt>,
--   or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:EventType'</a>, <a>eventType_code</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION </tt>; for example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
newEventType :: EventType

-- | The AWS service that is affected by the event. For example,
--   <tt>EC2</tt>, <tt>RDS</tt>.
eventType_service :: Lens' EventType (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
eventType_category :: Lens' EventType (Maybe EventTypeCategory)

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION </tt>; for example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
eventType_code :: Lens' EventType (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventType.EventType


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter

-- | The values to use to filter results from the <a>DescribeEvents</a> and
--   <a>DescribeEventAggregates</a> operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EventFilter
EventFilter' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventStatusCode) -> Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange) -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe [HashMap Text Text] -> Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange) -> EventFilter

-- | A list of event ARNs (unique identifiers). For example:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-CDE456",
--   "arn:aws:health:us-west-1::event/EBS/AWS_EBS_LOST_VOLUME/AWS_EBS_LOST_VOLUME_CHI789_JKL101"</tt>
[$sel:eventArns:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
[$sel:eventTypeCategories:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory)

-- | A list of unique identifiers for event types. For example,
--   <tt>"AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT","AWS_RDS_MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULED".</tt>
[$sel:eventTypeCodes:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of AWS Regions.
[$sel:regions:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of event status codes.
[$sel:eventStatusCodes:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventStatusCode)

-- | A list of dates and times that the event ended.
[$sel:endTimes:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange)

-- | A list of AWS Availability Zones.
[$sel:availabilityZones:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A list of entity ARNs (unique identifiers).
[$sel:entityArns:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of entity identifiers, such as EC2 instance IDs
--   (<tt>i-34ab692e</tt>) or EBS volumes (<tt>vol-426ab23e</tt>).
[$sel:entityValues:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of dates and times that the event began.
[$sel:startTimes:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange)

-- | The AWS services associated with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:services:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A map of entity tags attached to the affected entity.
--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
[$sel:tags:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe [HashMap Text Text]

-- | A list of dates and times that the event was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTimes:EventFilter'] :: EventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange)

-- | Create a value of <a>EventFilter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventArns:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_eventArns</a> - A
--   list of event ARNs (unique identifiers). For example:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-CDE456",
--   "arn:aws:health:us-west-1::event/EBS/AWS_EBS_LOST_VOLUME/AWS_EBS_LOST_VOLUME_CHI789_JKL101"</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCategories:EventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventFilter_eventTypeCategories</a> - A list of event type category
--   codes (<tt>issue</tt>, <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or
--   <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCodes:EventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventFilter_eventTypeCodes</a> - A list of unique identifiers for
--   event types. For example,
--   <tt>"AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT","AWS_RDS_MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULED".</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:regions:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_regions</a> - A list
--   of AWS Regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventStatusCodes:EventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventFilter_eventStatusCodes</a> - A list of event status codes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTimes:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_endTimes</a> - A
--   list of dates and times that the event ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:EventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventFilter_availabilityZones</a> - A list of AWS Availability
--   Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityArns:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_entityArns</a> - A
--   list of entity ARNs (unique identifiers).
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityValues:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_entityValues</a>
--   - A list of entity identifiers, such as EC2 instance IDs
--   (<tt>i-34ab692e</tt>) or EBS volumes (<tt>vol-426ab23e</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimes:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_startTimes</a> - A
--   list of dates and times that the event began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:services:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_services</a> - The
--   AWS services associated with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:EventFilter'</a>, <a>eventFilter_tags</a> - A map of
--   entity tags attached to the affected entity.
--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimes:EventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventFilter_lastUpdatedTimes</a> - A list of dates and times that
--   the event was last updated.
newEventFilter :: EventFilter

-- | A list of event ARNs (unique identifiers). For example:
--   <tt>"arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-CDE456",
--   "arn:aws:health:us-west-1::event/EBS/AWS_EBS_LOST_VOLUME/AWS_EBS_LOST_VOLUME_CHI789_JKL101"</tt>
eventFilter_eventArns :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A list of event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
eventFilter_eventTypeCategories :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory))

-- | A list of unique identifiers for event types. For example,
--   <tt>"AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT","AWS_RDS_MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULED".</tt>
eventFilter_eventTypeCodes :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A list of AWS Regions.
eventFilter_regions :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A list of event status codes.
eventFilter_eventStatusCodes :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty EventStatusCode))

-- | A list of dates and times that the event ended.
eventFilter_endTimes :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange))

-- | A list of AWS Availability Zones.
eventFilter_availabilityZones :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe [Text])

-- | A list of entity ARNs (unique identifiers).
eventFilter_entityArns :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A list of entity identifiers, such as EC2 instance IDs
--   (<tt>i-34ab692e</tt>) or EBS volumes (<tt>vol-426ab23e</tt>).
eventFilter_entityValues :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A list of dates and times that the event began.
eventFilter_startTimes :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange))

-- | The AWS services associated with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
eventFilter_services :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | A map of entity tags attached to the affected entity.
--   
--   Currently, the <tt>tags</tt> property isn't supported.
eventFilter_tags :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe [HashMap Text Text])

-- | A list of dates and times that the event was last updated.
eventFilter_lastUpdatedTimes :: Lens' EventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty DateTimeRange))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventFilter.EventFilter


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event

-- | Summary information about an AWS Health event.
--   
--   AWS Health events can be public or account-specific:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>Public events</i> might be service events that are not specific
--   to an AWS account. For example, if there is an issue with an AWS
--   Region, AWS Health provides information about the event, even if you
--   don't use services or resources in that Region.</li>
--   <li><i>Account-specific</i> events are specific to either your AWS
--   account or an account in your organization. For example, if there's an
--   issue with Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud in a Region that you use, AWS
--   Health provides information about the event and the affected resources
--   in the account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can determine if an event is public or account-specific by using
--   the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> parameter. For more information, see
--   <a>eventScopeCode</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe EventScopeCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EventTypeCategory -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EventStatusCode -> Event

-- | The most recent date and time that the event was updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTime:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
[$sel:arn:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS service that is affected by the event. For example,
--   <tt>EC2</tt>, <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:service:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the event began.
[$sel:startTime:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe POSIX

-- | This parameter specifies if the AWS Health event is a public AWS
--   service event or an account-specific event.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>PUBLIC</tt>, then the
--   <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value is always empty.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>ACCOUNT_SPECIFIC</tt>,
--   then the <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value lists the affected AWS
--   accounts in your organization. For example, if an event affects a
--   service such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and you have AWS accounts
--   that use that service, those account IDs appear in the response.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>NONE</tt>, then the
--   <tt>eventArn</tt> that you specified in the request is invalid or
--   doesn't exist.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:eventScopeCode:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe EventScopeCode

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION </tt>; for example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
[$sel:eventTypeCode:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The category of the event. Possible values are <tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, and <tt>accountNotification</tt>.
[$sel:eventTypeCategory:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe EventTypeCategory

-- | The AWS Availability Zone of the event. For example, us-east-1a.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the event ended.
[$sel:endTime:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region name of the event.
[$sel:region:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe Text

-- | The most recent status of the event. Possible values are
--   <tt>open</tt>, <tt>closed</tt>, and <tt>upcoming</tt>.
[$sel:statusCode:Event'] :: Event -> Maybe EventStatusCode

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:Event'</a>, <a>event_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The
--   most recent date and time that the event was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Event'</a>, <a>event_arn</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:Event'</a>, <a>event_service</a> - The AWS service
--   that is affected by the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:Event'</a>, <a>event_startTime</a> - The date and
--   time that the event began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventScopeCode:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventScopeCode</a> - This
--   parameter specifies if the AWS Health event is a public AWS service
--   event or an account-specific event.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>PUBLIC</tt>, then the
--   <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value is always empty.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>ACCOUNT_SPECIFIC</tt>,
--   then the <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value lists the affected AWS
--   accounts in your organization. For example, if an event affects a
--   service such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and you have AWS accounts
--   that use that service, those account IDs appear in the response.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>NONE</tt>, then the
--   <tt>eventArn</tt> that you specified in the request is invalid or
--   doesn't exist.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCode:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventTypeCode</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION </tt>; for example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCategory:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventTypeCategory</a> -
--   The category of the event. Possible values are <tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, and <tt>accountNotification</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Event'</a>, <a>event_availabilityZone</a> -
--   The AWS Availability Zone of the event. For example, us-east-1a.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:Event'</a>, <a>event_endTime</a> - The date and time
--   that the event ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Event'</a>, <a>event_region</a> - The AWS Region name
--   of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:Event'</a>, <a>event_statusCode</a> - The most
--   recent status of the event. Possible values are <tt>open</tt>,
--   <tt>closed</tt>, and <tt>upcoming</tt>.
newEvent :: Event

-- | The most recent date and time that the event was updated.
event_lastUpdatedTime :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
event_arn :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS service that is affected by the event. For example,
--   <tt>EC2</tt>, <tt>RDS</tt>.
event_service :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the event began.
event_startTime :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | This parameter specifies if the AWS Health event is a public AWS
--   service event or an account-specific event.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>PUBLIC</tt>, then the
--   <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value is always empty.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>ACCOUNT_SPECIFIC</tt>,
--   then the <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value lists the affected AWS
--   accounts in your organization. For example, if an event affects a
--   service such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and you have AWS accounts
--   that use that service, those account IDs appear in the response.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>NONE</tt>, then the
--   <tt>eventArn</tt> that you specified in the request is invalid or
--   doesn't exist.</li>
--   </ul>
event_eventScopeCode :: Lens' Event (Maybe EventScopeCode)

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION </tt>; for example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
event_eventTypeCode :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The category of the event. Possible values are <tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, and <tt>accountNotification</tt>.
event_eventTypeCategory :: Lens' Event (Maybe EventTypeCategory)

-- | The AWS Availability Zone of the event. For example, us-east-1a.
event_availabilityZone :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the event ended.
event_endTime :: Lens' Event (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region name of the event.
event_region :: Lens' Event (Maybe Text)

-- | The most recent status of the event. Possible values are
--   <tt>open</tt>, <tt>closed</tt>, and <tt>upcoming</tt>.
event_statusCode :: Lens' Event (Maybe EventStatusCode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.Event.Event


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails

-- | Detailed information about an event. A combination of an <a>Event</a>
--   object, an <a>EventDescription</a> object, and additional metadata
--   about the event. Returned by the <a>DescribeEventDetails</a>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDetails</a> smart constructor.
data EventDetails
EventDetails' :: Maybe Event -> Maybe EventDescription -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> EventDetails

-- | Summary information about the event.
[$sel:event:EventDetails'] :: EventDetails -> Maybe Event

-- | The most recent description of the event.
[$sel:eventDescription:EventDetails'] :: EventDetails -> Maybe EventDescription

-- | Additional metadata about the event.
[$sel:eventMetadata:EventDetails'] :: EventDetails -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:event:EventDetails'</a>, <a>eventDetails_event</a> - Summary
--   information about the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventDescription:EventDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eventDetails_eventDescription</a> - The most recent description of
--   the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventMetadata:EventDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eventDetails_eventMetadata</a> - Additional metadata about the
--   event.
newEventDetails :: EventDetails

-- | Summary information about the event.
eventDetails_event :: Lens' EventDetails (Maybe Event)

-- | The most recent description of the event.
eventDetails_eventDescription :: Lens' EventDetails (Maybe EventDescription)

-- | Additional metadata about the event.
eventDetails_eventMetadata :: Lens' EventDetails (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventDetails.EventDetails


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter

-- | The values to use to filter results from the <a>DescribeEventTypes</a>
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventTypeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data EventTypeFilter
EventTypeFilter' :: Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> EventTypeFilter

-- | A list of event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
[$sel:eventTypeCategories:EventTypeFilter'] :: EventTypeFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory)

-- | A list of event type codes.
[$sel:eventTypeCodes:EventTypeFilter'] :: EventTypeFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The AWS services associated with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:services:EventTypeFilter'] :: EventTypeFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>EventTypeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCategories:EventTypeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeFilter_eventTypeCategories</a> - A list of event type
--   category codes (<tt>issue</tt>, <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or
--   <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCodes:EventTypeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>eventTypeFilter_eventTypeCodes</a> - A list of event type codes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:services:EventTypeFilter'</a>, <a>eventTypeFilter_services</a>
--   - The AWS services associated with the event. For example,
--   <tt>EC2</tt>, <tt>RDS</tt>.
newEventTypeFilter :: EventTypeFilter

-- | A list of event type category codes (<tt>issue</tt>,
--   <tt>scheduledChange</tt>, or <tt>accountNotification</tt>).
eventTypeFilter_eventTypeCategories :: Lens' EventTypeFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory))

-- | A list of event type codes.
eventTypeFilter_eventTypeCodes :: Lens' EventTypeFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The AWS services associated with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
eventTypeFilter_services :: Lens' EventTypeFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.EventTypeFilter.EventTypeFilter


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem

-- | Error information returned when a
--   <a>DescribeAffectedEntitiesForOrganization</a> operation can't find or
--   process a specific entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem

-- | The 12-digit AWS account numbers that contains the affected entities.
[$sel:awsAccountId:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'] :: OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
[$sel:eventArn:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'] :: OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the error.
[$sel:errorName:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'] :: OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
[$sel:errorMessage:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'] :: OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsAccountId:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_awsAccountId</a> - The
--   12-digit AWS account numbers that contains the affected entities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventArn:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_eventArn</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorName:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_errorName</a> - The name of
--   the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_errorMessage</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
newOrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem :: OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem

-- | The 12-digit AWS account numbers that contains the affected entities.
organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_awsAccountId :: Lens' OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_eventArn :: Lens' OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the error.
organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_errorName :: Lens' OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
organizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem_errorMessage :: Lens' OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem.OrganizationAffectedEntitiesErrorItem


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent

-- | Summary information about an event, returned by the
--   <a>DescribeEventsForOrganization</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganizationEvent</a> smart constructor.
data OrganizationEvent
OrganizationEvent' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe EventScopeCode -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EventTypeCategory -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EventStatusCode -> OrganizationEvent

-- | The most recent date and time that the event was updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTime:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
[$sel:arn:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS service that is affected by the event, such as EC2 and RDS.
[$sel:service:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the event began.
[$sel:startTime:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | This parameter specifies if the AWS Health event is a public AWS
--   service event or an account-specific event.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>PUBLIC</tt>, then the
--   <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value is always empty.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>ACCOUNT_SPECIFIC</tt>,
--   then the <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value lists the affected AWS
--   accounts in your organization. For example, if an event affects a
--   service such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and you have AWS accounts
--   that use that service, those account IDs appear in the response.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>NONE</tt>, then the
--   <tt>eventArn</tt> that you specified in the request is invalid or
--   doesn't exist.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:eventScopeCode:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe EventScopeCode

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
[$sel:eventTypeCode:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The category of the event type.
[$sel:eventTypeCategory:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe EventTypeCategory

-- | The date and time that the event ended.
[$sel:endTime:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region name of the event.
[$sel:region:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe Text

-- | The most recent status of the event. Possible values are
--   <tt>open</tt>, <tt>closed</tt>, and <tt>upcoming</tt>.
[$sel:statusCode:OrganizationEvent'] :: OrganizationEvent -> Maybe EventStatusCode

-- | Create a value of <a>OrganizationEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTime:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_lastUpdatedTime</a> - The most recent date and
--   time that the event was updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:OrganizationEvent'</a>, <a>organizationEvent_arn</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_service</a> - The AWS service that is affected by
--   the event, such as EC2 and RDS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_startTime</a> - The date and time that the event
--   began.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventScopeCode:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_eventScopeCode</a> - This parameter specifies if
--   the AWS Health event is a public AWS service event or an
--   account-specific event.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>PUBLIC</tt>, then the
--   <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value is always empty.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>ACCOUNT_SPECIFIC</tt>,
--   then the <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value lists the affected AWS
--   accounts in your organization. For example, if an event affects a
--   service such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and you have AWS accounts
--   that use that service, those account IDs appear in the response.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>NONE</tt>, then the
--   <tt>eventArn</tt> that you specified in the request is invalid or
--   doesn't exist.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCode:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_eventTypeCode</a> - The unique identifier for the
--   event type. The format is <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION</tt>. For
--   example, <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCategory:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_eventTypeCategory</a> - The category of the event
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_endTime</a> - The date and time that the event
--   ended.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:OrganizationEvent'</a>, <a>organizationEvent_region</a>
--   - The AWS Region name of the event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:OrganizationEvent'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEvent_statusCode</a> - The most recent status of the
--   event. Possible values are <tt>open</tt>, <tt>closed</tt>, and
--   <tt>upcoming</tt>.
newOrganizationEvent :: OrganizationEvent

-- | The most recent date and time that the event was updated.
organizationEvent_lastUpdatedTime :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
organizationEvent_arn :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS service that is affected by the event, such as EC2 and RDS.
organizationEvent_service :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the event began.
organizationEvent_startTime :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | This parameter specifies if the AWS Health event is a public AWS
--   service event or an account-specific event.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>PUBLIC</tt>, then the
--   <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value is always empty.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>ACCOUNT_SPECIFIC</tt>,
--   then the <tt>affectedAccounts</tt> value lists the affected AWS
--   accounts in your organization. For example, if an event affects a
--   service such as Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud and you have AWS accounts
--   that use that service, those account IDs appear in the response.</li>
--   <li>If the <tt>eventScopeCode</tt> value is <tt>NONE</tt>, then the
--   <tt>eventArn</tt> that you specified in the request is invalid or
--   doesn't exist.</li>
--   </ul>
organizationEvent_eventScopeCode :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe EventScopeCode)

-- | The unique identifier for the event type. The format is
--   <tt>AWS_SERVICE_DESCRIPTION</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT</tt>.
organizationEvent_eventTypeCode :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The category of the event type.
organizationEvent_eventTypeCategory :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe EventTypeCategory)

-- | The date and time that the event ended.
organizationEvent_endTime :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region name of the event.
organizationEvent_region :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe Text)

-- | The most recent status of the event. Possible values are
--   <tt>open</tt>, <tt>closed</tt>, and <tt>upcoming</tt>.
organizationEvent_statusCode :: Lens' OrganizationEvent (Maybe EventStatusCode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEvent.OrganizationEvent


module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEventDetails

--   object, an <a>EventDescription</a> object, and additional metadata
--   about the event. Returned by the
--   <a>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</a> operation.

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem

-- | Error information returned when a
--   <a>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</a> operation can't find a
--   specified event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem
OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem

-- | Error information returned when a
--   <a>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</a> operation can't find a
--   specified event.
[$sel:awsAccountId:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'] :: OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
[$sel:eventArn:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'] :: OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the error.
[$sel:errorName:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'] :: OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | A message that describes the error.
--   
--   If you call the <tt>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</tt> operation
--   and receive one of the following errors, follow the recommendations in
--   the message:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>We couldn't find a public event that matches your request. To find
--   an event that is account specific, you must enter an AWS account ID in
--   the request.</li>
--   <li>We couldn't find an account specific event for the specified AWS
--   account. To find an event that is public, you must enter a null value
--   for the AWS account ID in the request.</li>
--   <li>Your AWS account doesn't include the AWS Support plan required to
--   use the AWS Health API. You must have either a Business or Enterprise
--   Support plan.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:errorMessage:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'] :: OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsAccountId:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventDetailsErrorItem_awsAccountId</a> - Error
--   information returned when a <a>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</a>
--   operation can't find a specified event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventArn:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventDetailsErrorItem_eventArn</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the event. The event ARN has the
--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorName:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventDetailsErrorItem_errorName</a> - The name of the
--   error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorMessage:OrganizationEventDetailsErrorItem'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventDetailsErrorItem_errorMessage</a> - A message that
--   describes the error.
--   
--   If you call the <tt>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</tt> operation
--   and receive one of the following errors, follow the recommendations in
--   the message:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>We couldn't find a public event that matches your request. To find
--   an event that is account specific, you must enter an AWS account ID in
--   the request.</li>
--   <li>We couldn't find an account specific event for the specified AWS
--   account. To find an event that is public, you must enter a null value
--   for the AWS account ID in the request.</li>
--   <li>Your AWS account doesn't include the AWS Support plan required to
--   use the AWS Health API. You must have either a Business or Enterprise
--   Support plan.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>DescribeEventDetailsForOrganization</a> operation can't find a
--   specified event.

--   <tt>arn:aws:health:event-region::event/SERVICE/EVENT_TYPE_CODE/EVENT_TYPE_PLUS_ID
--   </tt> format.
--   
--   For example, an event ARN might look like the following:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:health:us-east-1::event/EC2/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED/EC2_INSTANCE_RETIREMENT_SCHEDULED_ABC123-DEF456
--   </pre>

module Amazonka.AWSHealth.Types.OrganizationEventFilter

-- | The values to filter results from the
--   <a>DescribeEventsForOrganization</a> operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganizationEventFilter</a> smart constructor.
data OrganizationEventFilter
OrganizationEventFilter' :: Maybe DateTimeRange -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe DateTimeRange -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventStatusCode) -> Maybe DateTimeRange -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> OrganizationEventFilter
[$sel:lastUpdatedTime:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe DateTimeRange

-- | A list of 12-digit AWS account numbers that contains the affected
--   entities.
[$sel:awsAccountIds:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of event type category codes (issue, scheduledChange, or
--   accountNotification).
[$sel:eventTypeCategories:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventTypeCategory)

-- | A list of unique identifiers for event types. For example,
--   <tt>"AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT","AWS_RDS_MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULED".</tt>
[$sel:eventTypeCodes:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)
[$sel:startTime:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe DateTimeRange

-- | A list of AWS Regions.
[$sel:regions:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of event status codes.
[$sel:eventStatusCodes:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty EventStatusCode)
[$sel:endTime:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe DateTimeRange

-- | A list of entity ARNs (unique identifiers).
[$sel:entityArns:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | A list of entity identifiers, such as EC2 instance IDs (i-34ab692e) or
--   EBS volumes (vol-426ab23e).
[$sel:entityValues:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The AWS services associated with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>,
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:services:OrganizationEventFilter'] :: OrganizationEventFilter -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>OrganizationEventFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>organizationEventFilter_lastUpdatedTime</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsAccountIds:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_awsAccountIds</a> - A list of 12-digit AWS
--   account numbers that contains the affected entities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCategories:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_eventTypeCategories</a> - A list of event
--   type category codes (issue, scheduledChange, or accountNotification).
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTypeCodes:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_eventTypeCodes</a> - A list of unique
--   identifiers for event types. For example,
--   <tt>"AWS_EC2_SYSTEM_MAINTENANCE_EVENT","AWS_RDS_MAINTENANCE_SCHEDULED".</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_startTime</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:regions:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_regions</a> - A list of AWS Regions.
--

--   <a>organizationEventFilter_eventStatusCodes</a> - A list of event
--   status codes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_endTime</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityArns:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_entityArns</a> - A list of entity ARNs
--   (unique identifiers).
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityValues:OrganizationEventFilter'</a>,
--   <a>organizationEventFilter_entityValues</a> - A list of entity
--   identifiers, such as EC2 instance IDs (i-34ab692e) or EBS volumes
--   (vol-426ab23e).

--   with the event. For example, <tt>EC2</tt>, <tt>RDS</tt>.

--   accountNotification).

--   EBS volumes (vol-426ab23e).
organizationEventFilter_entityValues :: Lens' OrganizationEventFilter (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))
